queries: Some signers perform this sign with both hands twisting outwards as the hands uncross (so that they end with the palms facing away).
verbLexeme: 1. A situation or experience which is very serious and unpleasant. English = (be) terrible, (be) dreadful.
2. Of an event, to be very unsuccessful or unpleasant, especially when it is unexpected and causes a lot of damage or suffering. English = (be) disastrous.
nominalLexeme: 1. An event which is very unsuccessful or unpleasant, especially one that is unexpected and which causes a lot of damage or suffering. English = disaster.
